reviewText:
Suggestion and review.
Review: A great idea for a game, if your computer can run it decently. Not like mine, I'm still on Windows7.  Though, I wish it would work better for me. It is great though, I would suggest to every clone in Star Wars.
Suggestions
-Turrents move their gun so they can have potential to guard you better.
-Melee weapon, like a baton or tazer.
-Moving turrents, like spider turrents that can jump on walls and shoot, A.I. and stuff like that.
-More different kinds of turrents. (Rocket, poison, rats, etc.)
-Upgrades! (Upgrading from pistol to ak47 or somethin' like that.)
-Health packs, a certain amount per round.
-I have not played a full round. :D
-Option for extra prep time, for laggy people like me.
( Probably will add more in the future. :D )

reviewText: I would  review this game on it's content if I could play it. Apparently (And this is unique to Deadweight) it likes to crash Steam every time I try to play it, and leave an impossible to end process lingering around doing nothing. When I load up Steam after the crash, apparently I am playing it. So if the game is to get me to pay £3.99 to crash Steam everytime I click the play button, then 10/10!

reviewText: Deadweight is a randomised arena based survival shooter where you're armed with just a pistol, explosive crates & Sentry Turrets which can be re-positioned around the room. Hunting you down are countless waves of cloned androids for the sadistic amusement of the robot lord, King Mechanicus. Although this game is in it's early build and needs more work, it already shows good potential, and can only get better with more updates.

I really like it, however it does require balancing. The physics need fixing too. If you turn around when you have a turret in your hand too quickly, it can end up on top of the partitions, which you cannot retrieve. It can be somewhat annoying.

However the game is good and I'm loooking forward to any additions that the dev maybe adding in future.
